head.citation-title: An uncertainty principle for quaternion Fourier transform
head.abstracts: We review the quaternionic Fourier transform (QFT). Using the properties of the QFT we establish an uncertainty principle for the right-sided QFT. This uncertainty principle prescribes a lower bound on the product of the effective widths of quaternion-valued signals in the spatial and frequency domains. It is shown that only a Gaussian quaternion signal minimizes the uncertainty. Â© 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
